member.name: P:InRule.Repository.RuleRepositoryDefBase.AuthoringElementPath
member.summary: Gets the authoring path for this def.

All rootitems like rule application def and folder defs return 'root'.For an entity/independent Ruleset def, returns def name. For all other items like fields,dataelements,actions:
if contained under an Entity/Independent Ruleset, path returned in the form EntityName.FieldName,EntityName.ActionName, IndependentRuleSetName.RuleName.ActionName etc(dot-notation).
if contained under other items like Data,Schemas,EndPoints returns the def name.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.EndPoints.XmlSchemaDef.AllowGetXmlWithDupInstances
member.summary: Specifies whether Xml rendering of duplicate instances is allowed at runtime for entities associated with this schema.

remarks.para: The default setting is false, in which case an error occurs on Xml render when a given instance (EntityId) appears more than once in the hierarchical graph being rendered.
When this setting is true, duplicate instances are rendered with no error - note that if this xml is loaded back in, it results in distinct instances (EntityIds) rather than shared ones.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.EndPoints.XmlSchemaDef.CreateChildFields
member.summary: Specifies whether child relational fields are created for FK relationships

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.EndPoints.XmlSchemaDef.AutoSelectDependencies
member.summary: Specifies whether dependent entities are created for FK relationships

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.EndPoints.XmlSchemaDef.CreateEntitiesForAnonymousComplexTypes
member.summary: Specifies whether Entities are created during import for anonymous xs:complexTypes nested in non-global elements. True by default. If false, InRule Complex Fields will be created instead.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.EndPoints.XmlSchemaDef.IgnoreReadonlySettings
member.summary: When using a dataset XSD, allows specifying ignoring of ReadOnly setting on a column.
member.remarks:
This has the following effects:
At import time, it will not set FieldDef.ReadOnly true for XSD elements specifying ReadOnly.
At runtime, when a dataset instance is created by inrule (rather than being passed in), all of its columns will have ReadOnly false.
At runtime, attempting to set a column value (including autoincrement values) will now work, when before it failed due to the 2 constraints above.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.EndPoints.XmlSchemaDef.DisableConstraintAndValueListForEnumerations
member.summary: Specifies whether a Constraint and ValueList are created when importing XML schema with simpleType enumerations.

member.summary: Specifies whether to bind Fields that map to xs:enumeration restriction types to a ValueList during import.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.EndPoints.XmlSchemaDef.CreateConstraintsForEnumerationFields
member.summary: Specifies whether to create Constraint rules for Fields that map to xs:enumeration restriction types during import.

member.name: M:InRule.Repository.Client.RuleCatalogConnection.CreateRuleApplication(InRule.Repository.RuleApplicationDef,System.String,InRule.Repository.Client.DefSharingBehavior)
member.summary: Creates a new rule application in the catalog. New rule application will be checked in upon return.
member.param: Rule application to create.
A comment for the first checkin of the rule application.

If equal to DefSharingBehavior.Share, all ruleapp managed elements that match the content of the latest revision of existing sharable server managed elements will be shared from the server; otherwise, no share relationships will be established - all ruleapp managed elements will be created as revision 1.
member.returns: The newly created rule application.
member.exception: Throws InRuleCatalogException if Duplicate Ruleapp Names found in catalog.

member.name: M:InRule.Repository.Client.RuleCatalogConnection.PromoteRuleApplication(InRule.Repository.RuleApplicationDef,System.String)
member.summary: Promotes a rule application into the catalog. This is intended to be used only when the source rule application originated from another catalog.
member.overloads: PromoteRuleApplication without description.
member.param: Rule application to create or duplicate.
Checkin comment for new rule application revision.

item.description: If a rule application with the same guid already exists in the catalog, this app will be checked in as the latest revision of that app.
If no rule application with the same guid already exists in the catalog, this app will be checked in as the first revision.

Managed elements within the rule application are shared ONLY when guid-matched managed element exists in target catalog, is already marked sharable, and the content of the submitted definition matches the content of the latest revision of definition in the target catalog.

member.returns: The newly promoted rule application.
member.exception: If Duplicate Ruleapp Names found in catalog.
If rule application having same guid as ruleapp exists in target catalog and any part of it is checked-out.

item.description: If a rule application with the same guid already exists in the catalog, this app will be checked in as the latest revision of that app.

member.name: M:InRule.Repository.Client.RuleCatalogConnection.OverwriteRuleApplication(System.Guid,InRule.Repository.RuleApplicationDef,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Creates and checks in new revision of ruleapp; can be used to completely overwrite an existing ruleapp with another one. If target ruleapp has any checkouts (including by this user), an exception is thrown as described below.
member.param: Guid for ruleapp to be overwritten in the database. This guid is *always* preserved regardless of newRuleApp.Guid value
Rule application to be saved.
True to checkin after overwrite; false to leave the new ruleapp checked out.
Checkin comment for new rule application revision. If checkin is false, this is ignored.

item.description: New revision of targetRuleAppGuid is created - if checkin=true this is a new public revision, otherwise only a new internal revision
When newRuleApp.Guid matches targetRuleAppGuid, managed elements corresponding to guid-matched shared managed elements in the catalog are always preserved as shared.

When newRuleApp.Guid does not match targetRuleAppGuid, managed elements matching shared managed elements are preserved as shared only when the content of the newRuleApp managed element matches that of the latest revision of a guid-matched shared managed element in the catalog.
The returned .Guid is set to targetRuleAppGuid

member.returns: The newly created rule application revision.
member.exception: If any exclusive checkouts exist for app specified by targetRuleAppGuid
If any shared managed elements have a different app specified as master rule application

A description of the rule application.

If equal to DefSharingBehavior.Share, all ruleapp managed elements that match the content of the latest revision of existing sharable server managed elements will be shared from the server; otherwise, no share relationships will be established - all ruleapp managed elements will be created as revision 1.

member.name: M:InRule.Repository.Client.RuleCatalogController.PromoteRuleApplication(InRule.Repository.RuleApplicationDef,System.String)
member.summary: Promotes a rule application into the catalog. If a rule application with the same guid already exists in the catalog, this app will be checked in as the latest revision of that app. If no rule application with the same guid already exists in the catalog, this app will be checked in as the first revision. If a rule application with a different guid but same name already exists in the catalog, the entire promotion operation will fail. Child defs are shared ONLY when existing guid/revision exists in target catalog (and is shareable), and rule application already exists in target catalog. If any def/app in the catalog with guid matching a def/app from this rule application is currently checked out, the entire promotion operation will fail.
member.param: Rule application to create or duplicate.
Checkin comment for new rule application revision.
member.returns: The newly promoted rule application.
member.exception: Throws InRuleCatalogException if Duplicate Ruleapp Names found in catalog.
member.overloads: PromoteRuleApplication without description.

member.name: M:InRule.Repository.Client.RuleCatalogController.PromoteRuleApplication(InRule.Repository.RuleApplicationDef,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Promotes a rule application into the catalog. If a rule application with the same guid already exists in the catalog, this app will be checked in as the latest revision of that app. If a rule application with a different guid but same name already exists in the catalog, the entire promotion operation will fail. If a def with the same guid as any child def of this ruleapp already exists in the catalog, the corresponding child of the rule application will be checked in as the latest revision of that def. If any def/app in the catalog with guid matching a def/app from this rule application is currently checked out, the entire promotion operation will fail.
member.param: Rule application to create or duplicate.
Description for newly promoted rule application (use NULL to keep existing, if any).
Checkin comment for new rule application revision.
member.returns: The newly promoted rule application.
member.exception: Throws InRuleCatalogException if Duplicate Ruleapp Names found in catalog.

member.name: M:InRule.Repository.Infos.EvalInfo.GetEvalToTailContainerContext(InRule.Repository.Infos.Builders.BuildEngine)
member.summary: This method is used to repurpose the context of an expression to reroute to an alternate tail eval. It returns an eval info to the tail container of this eval. For example, getting the is invalid field for another field. First we need to resolve an expression to the target field, then reuse that context to resolve the expression to the invalid field which is linked to it. Used for - Resolving to element reference, invalid field, classifications, Meta Data / User Attributes For an eval that results in a ValueEvalInfo, returns an eval to the context of the value eval info For an eval that results in a ContainerEvalInfo, returns itself, the container is the tail container For an eval that results in a collection member reference, returns the collection member's data type

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.EndPoints.DatabaseConnection.IgnoreReadonlySettings
member.summary: Allows specifying ignoring of ReadOnly setting on a column.
member.remarks:
This has the following effects:
At import time, it will not set FieldDef.ReadOnly true for db columns specifying ReadOnly (including autoincrement ones).
At import time, the xsd embedded (stored with ruleapp) will have readonly false for all columns.
At runtime, when a dataset instance is created by inrule (rather than being passed in), all of its columns will have ReadOnly false.
At runtime, attempting to set a column value (including autoincrement values) will now work, when before it failed due to the 2 constraints above.

member.summary:
Creates an eval to a table data container including any version date selection logic Runtime name resolution allows the table arg to resolve to a string which is used to determine the table at runtime If the table expression resolves to a data element If it is not a table, an error is thrown The DataElementArg will be null The ResultDatatype is the TableInfo it resolved to
If the table expression resolves to a string If runtime name resolution is false, throws an error Otherwise, the result data type is an instance of UnknownTableInfo The DataElementArg will be populated
Creates an eval to a value list container including any version date selection logic

member.name: T:InRule.Repository.Infos.Builders.InfoLoadEngine
member.summary:
The info load engine is used during the load process to provide access to datatypes and the infostore. The info load engine is seperate from the build engine because the load process should not do any expression resolution until all of the loading is complete
Once everything is loaded, each info then goes through what it loaded and builds the appropriate infos for execution
Ultimatly we will be tracking the dependencies between defs and infos such that when a def changes we will be able to reload that difference and rebuild the impacted infos

member.name: T:InRule.Repository.Infos.CriticalBuildException
member.summary: Exception class for unexpected exceptions withing the build code which are due to defect. Once an error of this type is thrown, no additional exceptions with internal exceptions should be thrown. Once thrown, it should be rethrown all the way to the top of the build where it is logged as a build error info. Throwing this stops the build.

member.name: M:InRule.Repository.RuleApplicationDef.Validate(System.Boolean)
member.overloads: Validate a ruleapp for global namespace collisions, etc.
member.summary: Validate a ruleapp for global namespace collisions, etc. using useOriginalContentCode as specified
member.returns: Null if ok, validation message string otherwise.
member.remarks:
The following validations are performed:
**Duplicate name checks:
No two entities within a ruleapp may have the same name.
No entity items may have the same name as any data or endpoint items
No field names may be reused at a given entity folder level (but field names may be reused between different levels)
No field names may have the same name as any data or endpoint items
No two actions defined in an entity-scope actions folder may have the same name.
No actions defined in an entity-scope actions folder may have the same name as any data or endpoint items
No two user interface containers defined in an entity User Interface folder may have the same name.
No user interface containers defined in an entity User Interface folder may have the same name as any data or endpoint items
No two rule sets for a given entity may have the same name.
No rule sets may have the same name as any data or endpoint items
No rule sets for an entity may have the same name as any action folder actions for the entity.
No two rule element names (action or rule) within a ruleset may be reused at a given folder level.
No two data folders may have the same name.
No two may have the same name.
Note that rule element names are not checked for duplication except at the peer folder level, since they are not referenced anywhere.
Note that data subfolder items are included in the data names list.
**Field validity for names:
All endpoints must have valid (non-blank and a-z, 0-9, _) names.
All data elements must have valid (non-blank and a-z, 0-9, _) names.
All entities must have valid (non-blank and a-z, 0-9, _) names.
All fields must have valid (non-blank and a-z, 0-9, _) names.
All actions defined in an entity-scope actions folder must have valid (non-blank and a-z, 0-9, _) names.
All ruleset names must be valid if non-blank (a-z, 0-9, _)
Note that ruleset-scope rule element names (action or rule) are not checked for "valid" naming as with other items above.
**Field validity for other params:
SQL Query parameter names must be of the form @varname, where varname is comprised only of digits, letters or the underscore _
SQL Query parameter types names must be non-blank
Any entities referenced by fields as their type must exist.
**Schema Definition Endpoints:
There may be no more than one active Schema Definition Endpoint.
The schema-import-selected entities and fields must match 1:1 with those in the ruleapp, including name and type.
member.param: Indicates whether a new content code is generated if no errors are found. This value is usually false.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.RuleApplicationDef.EnableXsdValidationOnInternalSchema
member.summary: Specifies whether XSD schema validation will be performed on load for internal-schema entities.

remarks.para: The default setting is true, in which case any fields in loaded XML for an internal-schema entity that are not present as Entity StateLocation fields will result in an xsd validation exception.
When this setting is false, any extraneous fields will simply be ignored on load, with no error.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.RuleApplicationDef.AllowGetXmlWithDupInstancesOnInternalSchema
member.summary: Specifies whether Xml rendering of duplicate instances is allowed at runtime for internal schema entities.

remarks.para: The default setting is false, in which case an error occurs on Xml render when a given instance (EntityId) appears more than once in the hierarchical graph being rendered.
When this setting is true, duplicate instances are rendered with no error - note that if this xml is loaded back in, it results in distinct instances (EntityIds) rather than shared ones.

remarks.para: Attempts to match method using the following scenarios:

item.description: Exact type signature match: # of args, arg types match exactly in sequence.
Best match by argName: If multiple overloads, and have at least one named arg, return the overload having the max # of matches by argname.
Best match by argName: If multiple overloads, and have no named args and at least least one un-named arg, return the first overload if any having matching # args.
First overload: If there is at least one usable match by name, return this if neither of the above.

member.name: T:InRule.Repository.Import.Control.InRuleImportRuleWriteAllAttribute
member.summary:
Attribute specifying whether method or property calls within the target scope cause all bound objects to be refreshed.
Values: true (default) - all bound objects will be refreshed based on calls within the target scope false - no bound objects will be refreshed based on calls within the target scope
Notes: 1) Multiple applications of this attribute are considered from the outermost scope to the innermost scope with inner applications overriding the behavior of outer applications 2) When an individual object is refreshed, rules dependent on the object are placed back onto the agenda for rule execution as appropriate

member.name: M:InRule.Repository.Import.Control.InRuleImportRuleWriteAllAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor specifying that method or property calls within the target scope WILL cause all bound objects to be refreshed

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Specifies whether method or property calls within the target scope cause all bound objects to be refreshed

member.summary: Specifies whether method or property calls within the target scope cause all bound objects to be refreshed

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.Import.Control.InRuleImportRuleWriteAllAttribute.InRuleImportAttributeType
member.summary: Identifies the type of import attribute for this instance

member.name: T:InRule.Repository.Import.Control.InRuleImportRuleWriteAttribute
member.summary:
Attribute specifying whether method or property calls within the target scope cause the specified bound object to be refreshed
Notes: 1) Multiple applications of this attribute are considered for a given scope in addition to any applications in the containing scope 2) When an individual object is refreshed, rules dependent on the object are placed back onto the agenda for rule execution as appropriate

member.name: T:InRule.Repository.SchemaOperations.XsdLoader
member.summary: Responsible for creating XsdDirective objects from either an XSD document (and its linked import/include/redefine documents) or unbound/object-bound instances. Once generated, the objects are Silverlight-compatible and represent a compressed version of the XmlSchema objects. These objects are linked to ContainerInfo and FieldInfo instances (via a lookup table) on demand (GetXml()/ReadXml()) to assist XML serialization and deserialization at Runtime using the StateContainerXmlSerializer class. An instance can also generate the structure for an . This is used to generate the XSD-bound schema. This class replaces the XsdSchemaParser class in InRule v3.x.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.Configuration.AssemblyEndPointConfigElement.EndPointAssemblyPath
member.summary: Denotes the relative path to the directory that contains assemblies referenced within various rule applications. This location is important because it allows the rule engine to load.
member.remarks: Default is "EndPointAssemblies", which is relative from the executing assembly directory.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.Configuration.CachesConfigElement.DataCacheDepth
member.summary: Determines the number of data list items that will be held in the Catalog in-process data element cache. This cache is used for SQL queried and value lists that are defined in the rule applications.
member.remarks: Default is 1000.

member.name: P:InRule.Repository.Configuration.LicensingConfigElement.LicenseFolder
member.summary: Determines the directory where InRule will look to verify the license file. If left undefined or if a valid license file is not found at the specified location, InRule will next check for a valid license file in the bin directory of the application that calls the rule engine.
member.remarks:
Valid license keys can also be recorded to the machine.config file.
Note this is the path to the directory containing the license file, and not the file itself.
Default is null.

member.name: F:InRule.Repository.Regression.TestType.Assertion

member.name: F:InRule.Repository.Regression.TestType.Compare
member.summary: In comparison testing, the user defines input and expected output test scenarios. The regression test compares the actual and expected outputs.

member.name: F:InRule.Repository.Regression.TestType.Performance
member.summary: In performance testing, the user defines how many times to run a test, along with an input test scenario and execution parameters. The test reports performance results.

member.name: M:InRule.Repository.Lexicon.ReservedWordProvider.IsValidNamePattern(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the supplied string matches the pattern for valid 'identifier' names.
member.param: A string that is a candidate 'identifier' name.
member.returns: True if the string matches the pattern for valid 'identifier' names, false otherwise
member.remarks:
This does not ensure that the name is unique amongst other names in scope.
Schema and other items which are addressable within rule syntax must be named according to 'valid' 'identifier' naming restrictions:
Identifier names must start with a letter or '_' and must contain only letters, digits, and '_'
